page.title: 04The Hamlet of Sewards End
page.content: The square consists mainly of the hamlet of Sewards End.Gates, the agricultural suppliers (tractor sales and repairs), a sub Post Office in the local shop,The Green Dragon Pub with a beer garden and an unusual {Chapel} where you can only be christened and buried (not married) are the main non-residential buildings. Many people were out on the day we called (a Tuesday) as some had gone to market in Saffron Walden and others are commuters.Those residents who did talk to us had either just moved in or had lived there for up to sixty years.Some wished for a bigger shop, and others for a childrens' playground.
